Instruction: Heat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, 9 tablespoons of sugar, and salt in the large mixing bowl of a stand mixer on low speed until well mixed.
Incorporate the butter until well blended.
Incorporate milk, followed by eggs, and then raisins, making sure to mix each ingredient thoroughly before adding the next.
Place the dough into the greased loaf pan and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of sugar.

Bake in the oven that has been preheated until the bread has risen and the top is a golden brown color, typically around 45 minutes. A toothpick or cake tester can be used to check if the center is cooked through.
Allow the bread to cool for approximately 10 minutes before cutting into slices. Enjoy while warm.

I prefer to utilize my stand mixer for combining the ingredients. As the milk and eggs are added, the mixture thickens, making it challenging to stir manually. Thoroughly mixing the ingredients enhances the outcome.
